data.text:
In Woody Allen: The 1980s

Allen’s next project, Crimes and Misdemeanors (1989), ranks among his finest films. An ambitious Fyodor Dostoyevsky-like meditation on the nature of evil and culpability, it centred on Martin Landau’s portrayal of an ophthalmologist who wrestles with guilt after ordering the murder of his mistress (Anjelica Huston) to prevent…
